intro: Omphalodes japonica f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered Japanese omphalodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing a delicate, lace-like appearance. Native to Japan, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and shady landscapes.
